page.title: 01An "overview"
page.content: { An"overview"of the study area. The study area as a whole is sparcely populated,mainly rural in character,and for the most part well away from the main lines of national communication.The reduction in the "farm" labour force has made an impact particularly in Claxton,and to a lesser extent in Rockland St.Mary, cutting back the population dramatically in the immediate past, consequently the elderly who tend not to move,constitute a very high proportion of the total.Latterly an influx of"new blood",into newly built "character"properties has stemmed this drift;most owners working in Norwich. It is likely that its comparative remoteness,its lack of direct comunications and its inclusion in the "Green Belt"and Coun. Develop.Scheme will save it from more develop.
